messages: 4cb838f24a383782871990f00ff3f757 (16:32): hello guys. :) is someone here who has a working qt4.2 (tp1 or snapshot) installation and could say me please how cpu usage is about while running graphicsview examples? (e.g. collidingmice in fullscreen) perfomance here is really bad. maybe it's due to my system and compiler..
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (16:33): is your opengl setup okay ? what platform ?
4cb838f24a383782871990f00ff3f757 (16:33): no problem, i hope there is another :)
4cb838f24a383782871990f00ff3f757 (16:34): gentoo linux x86, gcc 3.4.5, opengl seems to be ok: glxgears about 6000 fps, direct rendering is on
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (16:34): maybe ahigerd or blockd did try, I use the packages from my distro, and don't have a very powerful box (3+ hours to compile qt)
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (16:34): ok so opengl is not the problem
4cb838f24a383782871990f00ff3f757 (16:36): i've currently compiled gcc 4.1.1 and now qt 4.2 snapshot is compiling with it. then i will try again my app, perhaps there is a boom :D

6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (16:41): BTW, I can't get correct accents in Qt 4.1.4 when I type strings in my cpp files. Looks like there is an UTF-8 problem (my distro is full UTF-8). Do I have to convert the code to ISO8859-1 ?
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (16:57): ok I use fromUtf8 and it works :)
4cb838f24a383782871990f00ff3f757 (17:02): i am stumped. :( no real change with g++ 4.1.1 and current qt snapshot in release version..
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (17:03): maybe it's slow because it's a debug version...
4cb838f24a383782871990f00ff3f757 (17:05): boundingRect() looks like: inline QRectF boundingRect() const { return rectangle; }
4cb838f24a383782871990f00ff3f757 (17:05): but apparently g++ does not inline the method..
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (17:07): BTW, could someone test a procedure in designer ? I think I've found a bug
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:07): for me colliding mice is fast on 1280x1024
4cb838f24a383782871990f00ff3f757 (17:08): chakie_work, what about the cpu perfomance? is it high?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:08): how did you measure it?
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (17:09): you should see it in the list
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (17:10): anyway, anything using opengl is a bit a cpu hog
4cb838f24a383782871990f00ff3f757 (17:10): yeah thats definetly too much. i have a map with 10200 edges to calculate
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (17:11): chrisb7: you maybe have to make several zoom levels
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (17:12): a edge will be tiny on your screen right ?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:12): how did you turn on timing for glxgears?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:12): that crap shit has no --help
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (17:12): so you should maybe make bounding boxes that contain say 100 edges
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (17:13): chakie_work: it is written in the console
4cb838f24a383782871990f00ff3f757 (17:13): just start glxgears, after 5 seconds it will output your fps
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (17:13): like XXX frames in 5 sec : YY fps
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:14): i just wanted to compare my numbers to your 6000
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:16): some craptastic intel integrated stuff
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (17:17): i915 are very well supported by linux
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (17:17): and intel made their driver open source recently
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:18): it works very well for 2d, no question about that
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:18): i wouldn't bother trying to get opengl working properly on this system, not worth it
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:18): i noticed some rendering bugs in colliding mice though
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:19): start it, fullscreen, switch virtual, come back -> the background is not properly updated
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (17:38): Does someone know how to set the application icon in Qt4/Win32 without the rc program ? I use MinGW
